meanings.definition: Untidy or dirty in appearance or habits.
meanings.sent1: The slobbish room was filled with scattered clothes and unwashed dishes.
meanings.sent2: She always looks slobbish with her wrinkled shirt and messy hair.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat looked slobbish after rolling around in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The once pristine garden now appeared slobbish with overgrown weeds and neglected flowers.
meanings.sent5: The slobbish smell coming from the kitchen made everyone cringe.

meanings.definition: A person who is lazy and messy in their habits.
meanings.sent1: The new roommate turned out to be a slobbish who never cleaned up after themselves.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled as the office slobbish for always leaving a mess at her desk.
meanings.sent3: The slobbish in the group always forgot to bring their own supplies to the study sessions.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the slobbish of the family, leaving a trail of chaos wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The slobbish's desk was a chaotic mix of papers, pens, and half-eaten snacks.
